name: places/ChIJS0h0EB70wokR8EamWtoMZIk
adrFormatAddress: 4295 Broadway, New York, NY 10033, USA

originalText.text: I know that the NYPD 34 precinct gets a lot of calls. I noticed it's a pretty busy precinct although when you have time off, & you're rolling around in your NYPD vehicles you really have to start giving tickets to car's that are parked in front of fire hydrants. I live on Seaman Ave. where people park in front of the fire hydrants for hours. NYPD Officer's have passed not going to a call, & literally do nothing. Don't stop, & obviously don't care. No ticket. They just keep it moving. That's not appropriate. Please do what you know you should be doing. Traffic Enforcement gives tickets, & so do you. It's not one or the other. I obviously don't hate the NYPD 34 Precinct, but this does upset me. Please do what's right, & Stay Safe Officer's.

originalText.text: I recently contacted this precinct because I was concerned for a family member and I asked the officer who answered my call to please conduct a welfare check at her apartment. The officer was cordial, polite and within thirty minutes an officer returned my call to let me know that they had arrived at her apartment and that she was safe.

text.text: I recently contacted this precinct because I was concerned for a family member and I asked the officer who answered my call to please conduct a welfare check at her apartment. The officer was cordial, polite and within thirty minutes an officer returned my call to let me know that they had arrived at her apartment and that she was safe.

originalText.text: I was arrested as a teenager for a crime that was later dismissed by the courts. They came to my house and arrested me. After arresting me they illegally destroyed the rest of my house and when my brother asked them if they needed a warrant to search his room the officer told him if he didnt let him in his room they would arrest my mother and grandmother. After that they then had a female officer strip search my brothers ex-girlfriend naked in our bathroom illegally. When I was taken to the precinct and they gave me my form they wrote down I had no money with me. I had 200$. The arresting officer robbed me as a kid. My arresting officer was a plain clothes detective. I unfortunately do not have his name available. But plan to update when I do. I have also met good cops from this precinct who acted really kind so I didn't one star. My experience was over 10 years ago and understand the precinct could have changed a lot. But I felt I had to share my story just in case anyone experienced similar but was scared to step forward. I went to internal affairs and the station but felt like nothing was done and no support or interest shown.

I went to internal affairs and the station but felt like nothing was done and no support or interest shown.

originalText.text: The 34th precinct have some serious lack of public relations. I guess given the low education levels in this district I’m not surprised why police officers can get away with public misconduct. I received a ticket for trying to park my vehicle, but what’s even more surprising is the date on which the ticket was given, the end of the month, i.e. “quota”. I don’t blame the officer for his lack of professionalism nor his sergeant, I blame my district council member.

originalText.text:
I hope I get officers name correct... I believe it’s Monteli (he had a terrible hand writing) I just moved to the neighborhood and had low expectations going in for an insignificant lost package claim, but this officer gave me attention and took me seriously. Even gave me his contact info and said “have them call me directly to get this resolved...”
Everything was resolved. Never in a million years expected for NYPD to take me seriously over a something so small. Thank you! I’m glad you are serving my new community.
